comments: Write 1,2,3,4,... in a hexagonal spiral around 0, then a(n) is the sequence found by reading the line from 0 in the direction 0,5,... - _Floor van Lamoen_, Jul 21 2001. The spiral begins:......16..15..14....17..5...4...13..18..6...0...3...1219..7...1...2...11..26..20..8...9...10..25....21..22..23..24Connection to triangular numbers: 4T_n + S_n where T_n is triangular number n and S_n is square number n. [_William A. Tedeschi_, Sep 12 2010]Also, second octagonal numbers. - _Bruno Berselli_, Jan 13 2011Sequence found by reading the line from 0, in the direction 0, 16,... and the line from 5, in the direction 5, 33,..., in the square spiral whose vertices are the generalized octagonal numbers A001082. - _Omar E. Pol_, Jul 18 2012
